story: We went to the mall to buy christmas presents.
It was pretty crowded and the parking lot was nuts.
We circled the lot trying to find a space.
We eventually wanted one but someone wanted to fight us for it.
We just let them have it and tried to find a new spot at the mall.
Billy dared his friend Johnny to enter a rodeo.
Johnny entered the bull riding event in the Rodeo.
Johnny's bull twisted and turned and bucked him off.
Johnny landed on his head in the arena dirt.
Johnny decided that he would not enter any more rodeos.
The walls are thin in my apartment.
Yesterday, my neighbor's baby was crying all day long.
It gave me a major headache, but a great idea.
You see, I like my neighbor.
That's why tonight, I'm babysitting.
I had a big test the other day.
The night before the test my friends went to go see a movie.
I should've stayed and studied but I went with them instead.
I got a terrible grade on my test.
I should've stayed in and studied.
Sally was walking along when she found a marble.
A little way down the road she found another.
She started following a path that was littered with marbles.
Eventually Sally stopped under a big oak tree.
She started to dig and found a whole bag full of old marbles!
Dora and Lena were children during The Great Depression.
Their parents were very poor and they lived in a very small house.
The girls were thankful to be able to share an orange at Christmas.
It was the only gift their parents could afford.
Dora and Lena grew up to be very frugal except at Christmas!
Kristi loved to go hiking in the mountains.
One day she was alone on the trail when she heard a low growl.
Slowly turning around she saw a mountain lion crouching down.
Kristi had been a girl scout so she knew what to do.
Hands in her pockets, she lifted her arms high to seem bigger.
Rob planned to apply to medical school.
He filled out his application in one night.
He asked a favorite professor to write him a recommendation letter.
He was optimistic that the positive recommendation would help.
Later that month, he found out he had been accepted.
Tom was at the park one day.
There was a small kids festival going on.
Tom noticed a free balloon sign.
They were supposed to be for kids.
Tom was so excited they made an exception for him.
Susie was in high school.
She wanted to go on a college tour.
So she went off to it.
When she got there she liked it.
She thought the area was nice.
I was browsing the internet.
I needed some pictures for a project.
I saved several images to a folder.
I printed them off.
I glued the images to my poster.
Tim was a very curious child who was interested in the solar system.
His mom wanted to aid in his curiosities.
She bought him a telescope so he could see all the planets.
Tim was so happy when he unwrapped the telescope.
He spent the next few weeks exploring the solar system.
I went to get a new phone today at my phone service providers.
I picked out a new one to upgrade to and traded in the old phone.
After paying, I went out of the store with my new phone.
I heard a huge noise as I got into my car in the parking lot.
I looked down and my new phone was shattered on the ground.
The boy woke up, complaining of hunger.
I made him a stack of pancakes.
He began to feel ill, so he laid down on the couch.
I put on cartoons for him to watch.
I ended up spending the day watching cartoons with him.
Dan is a traveling man.
He often visits mysterious and exotic places.
He decides to visit the country of India next.
He gets on a plane and travels to India.
When arriving in India he is amazed at how beautiful it is.
Briana had been refusing to complete her chores.
Her mom was at her wits end with what to do about it.
Finally she decided to bribe Briana.
She promised her a new toy in exchange for the toys.
Luckily this prompted Briana to complete her chores.
Jenna likes to give back to her community.
She has spent a lot of time thinking about what she can do.
Her friend mentioned doing a toy drive for needy kids for Christmas.
They got together and did the drive and took in so many toys!
Over 100 children got an extra gift from their efforts.
Michel went to the hair salon.
He wanted his hair to look like Tom Cruise.
The barber cut his hair for two hours.
Michel went home to his parents house.
His mom thought he looked like Tom Cruise.
I have been saving up to buy a new motorcycle.
I finally found one to buy and went to buy it.
I hopped on it to ride it home.
On the way home I lost my balance and wrecked.
I ended up breaking both arms and totaling my new bike.
Allie needed glasses.
She had to get her eyes checked first.
In the meantime she used her old ones.
They were too small.
Thankfully no one laughed about it.
Everyone in the neighborhood hated Nicolette.
She flirted with all of the husbands on the street.
The wives would glare when she would walk by.
Nicolette wanted to try and win some friends over.
She delivered cookies to all of the wives.
My niece works for the Massachusetts DMV.
The DMV was closed on Columbus Day.
The day after, some customers complained about the DMV.
They wanted to know why this fact was not publicized.
She said it was on the DMV website.
Amy had a microwave that she purchased in her dorm room.
She no longer shared it with her roommate.
One day she tried to heat up her food and it wouldn't come on.
She tried everything but the microwave no longer worked.
Amy knew her roommate had broken it out of spite.
The kids didn't wash their dishes after dinner.
They threw their plates in the sink and left.
Their mom was frustrated.
She decided to leave the sink full with dishes.
Two weeks later, there was a large pile in the sink.
The other day I saw a snake out on the lawn.
I went inside to get a broom.
I couldn't find a broom so I found a large stick.
I shooed the snake away with the large stick.
I haven't seen the snake since.
Today the iPhone was coming out.
I was very excited for this release.
I waited in line for three hours.
When I got to the front, I opened the box.
I was amazed at what I saw.
Bob just started college this year and is a Zoology major.
He purchased all his textbooks and pretty much ran out of money.
He then went to his first week of classes and felt overwhelmed.
Everything was about complicated science and medicine.
Bob hoped that all this expensive hard work would be worth it.
Jim's puppy Spot was recently found and returned home.
Jim was so happy to have Spot back he gave him a bath.
Afterwards he played with Spot for hours.
Jane later found Jim and Spot asleep on the floor.
She tucked Jim in kissed his forehead goodnight.
Gina was anxious as she waited for the principal.
She was also very bored.
She looked around for something to read.
There were no magazines in this room.
There was nothing she could do to occupy her time.
My husband proposed to me three times.
The first time was at sunset on the beach and the car got stuck.
The next day, at another beach, a rogue wave snuck up on him.
Finally, the next day we went inland and he found a beautiful mansion.
He asked, and I said yes.
Tom was going to high-school for the first time.
He decided to reinvent himself.
He created a whole new style for himself.
All the other students thought he looked goofy.
Tom was picked on alot after that.
Neil wanted to vacation in Asia.
He needed to stretch his dollar.
So he decided to fly to Thailand.
There, he found great deals on lodging and food.
Thailand was a budget traveler's paradise!
Every seat was taken at the new diner in town.
A couple arrived and asked for the next table.
The host did a lap around the dining room to find any open table.
He saw a couple begin to stand up and told a bus boy to clean it.
When he told the new guests the news they rejoiced.
Alexis had a gymnastics meet.
A lot of people were coming to watch and she wanted to be the best.
Her first event was the floor and she got a perfect ten.
Next she performed on the bars and got a 9 point 9.
She won two gold medals.
Rina went to Russia on a student exchange program.
She was nervous at first - Russia was so foreign.
But soon she was very comfortable there.
She even learned to speak fluent Russian!
At the end of the semester, she hated to leave.
Pablo's mother's birthday was approaching quickly.
Pablo wanted to give his mother something very special.
He didn't have a job or money to get her something nice.
Pablo used his talent of painting and painted his mom a portrait.
She was so happy with the painting that she cried.
Trent found it hard to learn how to lace his shoes.
His mother showed him over and over but he didn't grasp it.
He had to practice on his own to eventually understand it.
When he did, he was so happy, he went for a run.
And when his shoelaces were undone, he did them again.
Lisa was recently divorced.
Her friends begged her to get out of the house.
Lisa agreed to see a movie with her friends.
She had a great time at the movies.
Lisa eventually begin going out more with her friends.
Amanda was doing some landscaping.
She bought a big shrub for her side yard.
The shrub grew two feet in the first month.
It took over her patio.
Amanda had to chop it down.
Patricia loved puns.
Her friends moaned in disdain whenever she made a new pun.
However, her father loved and encouraged her behavior.
For father's day, Patricia made her dad a card.
It had a hand-drawn owl and the words "Owl always love you!"
Julian was nervous for his first piano recital.
At only 5 years old, he was the youngest to perform.
Julian listened to the other's play their songs and became relaxed.
When it was his turn, he took a deep breath.
Julian had the best performance of the night.
I went to the dog track kennel one day and hoped to find a new pet.
The long rows of double stacked crates held so many hopeful faces.
Suddenly, big brown eyes met mine and I knew I had to meet this one.
A big red fawn boy came out to greet me and leaned on me.
That was the day my first greyhound picked me.
Nate went to the movies!
He bought a big bucket of popcorn!
He bought a large drink!
He ate until he was full.
But he ate so much he ended up missing the movie!
Jenny was always running late.
Her husband bought her a watch to keep her on time.
It worked great!
Soon, Jenny was on time for every appointment.
The watch made a huge difference in her life.
Annabelle laid lifelessly against the window.
She was awaiting the arrival of her owner.
The sound of the garage door opening alerted Annabelle's ear to perk u.
Annabelle arose and ran towards the door.
She found her owner standing there with a dog treat in hand.
People shook their heads because Stu wouldn't buy a car.
Each day, Stu pedaled a bike ten miles to and from work.
While his peers suffered health woes, Stu was as fit as a teen.
When Stu retired, many of his buddies were already dead.
Stu rode his bike to visit them at the cemetery regularly.
Jan was working out hard.
She brought a water bottle to the gym.
She filled it up at the drinking fountain.
She was so thirsty that she gulped it all down.
She felt refreshed from the cold water.
I was having a hard time picking out a gift for my mother.
It was almost Christmas and I wanted to get her something really good.
I searched high and low, all over the mall.
Finally, I found a stuffed animal that looked just like her dog.
I had found the perfect Christmas gift.
Sarah was not excited to go to school.
She missed school due to having the flu last week.
She had a week's worth of homework to make up.
Sarah had to make-up 3 tests that day.
She was so exhausted that she fell asleep on the bus back home.
Tom was a college student.
He noticed his classmates were better dressed than himself.
Tom went shopping for new clothes.
Tom spent hours at the mall.
Tom left with a whole new wardrobe.
Richard was scared of dogs.
He thinks every dog will bite him.
He visited his friends house one day.
His friend introduced him to his pet dog chihuahua.
Richard almost fainted.
Allie was watching her favorite tv program.
All of the sudden the tv went out.
Allie was devastated.
Now she couldn't watch her show.
She then had to buy a new one.
Amy was waiting on a guy from school to call her.
She waited near the phone.
Every time it rang her heart skipped a beat.
Every time it rang it wasn't him.
Amy sat in her room brooding the whole night.
The man was invited to a wedding.
He did not respond.
The bride's feelings were hurt.
The groom called the man.
The man confirmed that he would attend.
Drew wanted to try out for the football team.
But he was too slow and too little to play.
He spent all summer lifting weight and doing sprints.
He gained ten pounds of muscle and became very fast.
He ended up making the team and becoming the star player.
Gina's sister was afraid of a deer at a truck stop.
The dead deer was in a truck next to their car.
Gina went out to see the deer.
The truck had been replaced by a sports car.
Gina's sister was relieved to hear it was gone.
Nell felt honored when the new girl asked her to come over.
She felt a thrill when she saw the girl's parents weren't home.
The new girl told Nell they could do whatever they wanted.
They raided the fridge and watched shows her parents wouldn't allow.
When Nell got home, she felt guilty instead of happy.
Ren finished her summer finals.
For the rest of the day, she went to the club.
Although she had two weeks off of school, she did nothing but sleep.
When school started, she came unprepared.
She had to buy all of her textbooks and supplies that week.
Bertha's sixth birthday was coming up soon.
All she wanted was a party with her friends.
Her parents carefully planned an extravagant party.
Bertha enjoyed herself.
Her parents were very proud of the job they had done.
Andrew knew his son loved video games.
So for his son's birthday he bought him video games.
It was delivered to his house.
So Andrew wrapped it.
Then gave it to his son.
Hannah bought some boxed pasta.
She got all of the ingredients out on the counter.
Then, she put a pot on the stove.
She followed the instructions to cook the pasta.
When she was done, she ate her pasta.
My hamster was acting very strange this morning.
I took him out of his cage.
Then he bit me.
I thought he might be hungry, so I gave him some lettuce.
He ate it up quickly.
Conner turned on his kitchen light and it wouldn't light up.
He took it down to inspect it.
The light had a broken wire.
He went to Lowes and bought a new light fixture.
He installed his new light and it works perfectly.
Tim always loved stand up comedy.
He wanted to be a comedian himself.
He uploaded some of his sets online.
All the comments were negative criticisms.
Tim decided to give up comedy.
John was always really good at Soccer, so he decided to challenge Joe.
Joe couldn't pass this up, and they began to play.
They were both evenly matched, but Joe was pulling ahead.
In the end, Joe won by over 30 points.
They both laughed it off and went and got ice cream together.
James lost his wallet.
He called up his friends.
He realized he left his wallet in his friend's car.
He drove to retrieve his wallet.
He thanked his friend for finding his wallet.
I was in the bathroom one morning getting ready for work.
While standing in front of the mirror, I began to brush me teeth.
When I finished brushing my teeth, I reached for my medication.
After I grabbed the bottle, I spilled pills into my sink.
The pills fell into the drain, and I had to call in for replacements.
Tim wanted new ripped pants.
When he went to the store but they were too expensive.
So he bought normal jeans from another store.
When he got home he made rips in them himself.
His friends complimented him on his cool jeans.
Kim hated overhead lighting.
Her boyfriend's new apartment had nothing but.
They were going to move in together.
Kim's boyfriend surprised her with new lamps he bought.
She loved how thoughtful he was.
Beth decided to go on a blind date.
It wasn't her thing but he hadn't had much luck lately.
She arrived to dinner at 8pm.
She waited 15 minutes until her date finally showed.
Her date was rude the whole night and Beth swore off Blind dates.
A couple talked about date ideas.
One of them suggested they paint something.
They went to a local kiln.
They made a plate together.
They picked it up the next day.
Tom was really restless.
He wanted to tire himself out.
He decided to go on a run.
He ran across the park.
When he finished running, he immediately fell asleep at home.
I bought a retro toy called Fluffkin.
I bought the purple haired doll home in its original box yesterday.
I placed it on the mantle, hoping it would attract questions.
My children have fallen in love with it, and asked to play with it.
It ended up lying on the floor, covered in sticky stuff.
Marik opened his closet door looking for something to wear.
All his clothes were off their hangars and in a pile by the door.
The door rang, his date was here to pick him up.
Marik put on deodorant and cologne and opened the door.
He was naked, but decided it didn't matter and left on the date.
My sister in law had only four teeth left.
She grew up poor and could not afford dental care.
The teeth were bothering her.
She had to get them pulled.
She has appointments to get dentures.
Martin was an older man with a lot of life experience.
He wanted to put it all in a book.
So he decided to sit down and write one.
He wrote a book about all the things that happened in his life.
He went on to sell his book and made a lot of money from it.
Alexander was in class.
He noticed a weird red stain on his backpack.
He opened the pockets to investigate.
Then he saw that his drink mix had spilled.
The red liquid was every where.
Selena invited her group of friends one evening.
They celebrated late into the night.
Around 3 am, the police banged on her door.
She opened and got scared.
It turned out they were too loud and had to lower the music.
Joe needed new shoes.
The ones he wanted were too expensive.
He decided to save up his money.
He finally had enough saved.
Joe was excited to buy his new shoes.
Katie was really looking forward to her birthday.
More than anything, she wanted a CD player as a present.
On her birthday, she received many lovely presents.
Finally, she opened the last one.
She got a CD player!
Kelly couldn't wait to go to Sephora for the first time to buy makeup.
The moment she walked into the store she was in total awe.
The entire store was filled with hundreds of makeup brands and perfume
Kelly picked up nearly everything she could get her hands on.
By the time she left the store, Kelly had about 12 different bags full
Ky was a little chubby and wanted to lose 20 pounds before summer.
In spring she began dieting and walking each day.
She even asked friends to join her on her walks to keep her company.
After four weeks she had lost ten pounds.
And by summer, she had lost the other ten!
Horace loves using his grill and wishes he had more chances to use it.
He decides to grill a burger for himself at home.
Horace loves the way the freshly grilled burger tastes.
It doesn't bother him that he grilled all alone.
Horace decides he does not need a special occasion to grill.
Carey walked her dog in the dog park every day.
Seeing all the dogs there gave her an idea.
She decided to start a dog walking business.
She put up fliers and knocked on doors of dog owners.
Now Carey walks 9 dogs in the dog park every day.
Kia's dog ran away.
She was heartbroken.
She put up signs all over.
Soon a neighbor returned her dog.
Kia was so grateful!
In 2012 I was all scheduled and set to have a major surgery.
It was the worst time ever to get a dog.
I didn't anticipate falling in love with a little white dog.
A random stop at the humane society changed my life forever.
I brought that little white dog home and she helped me heal.
Dan wanted to paint his front door a bold color.
Dan decided to paint his door a bright green color.
Dan's neighbors were not pleased with the color, and complained.
After several complaints, Dan decided to paint the door brown.
Dan was sad he could not keep his bold colored door.
Jack has a test in science.
He has been studying all week.
He still does not feel ready.
Jack got to his test and failed.
He begged his teacher for a retake and she said no.
Allie loved dogs.
She saw a dog on the sidewalk today.
She decided to pet it.
When she did however, it bit her.
Allie was yelling in pain.
Sally didn't have any clean clothes to wear.
She had to do the laundry.
She drove to her local laundromat.
She read a book while she waited for her clothes.
She put on fresh clothes and went out with her friends after.
Sal and his wife flew to Hawaii for vacation.
After their vacation they went back to the airport.
The airline had overbooked the flight.
They asked for volunteers to stay in Hawaii an extra day.
Sal and his wife were happy to volunteer!
Jane has a history test tomorrow.
She has not studied at all.
She really does not want to stay up all night.
Jennifer studied her notes and hoped for the best.
When she got to class, her test was canceled.
Anna had lost her favorite bracelet.
Sadly she searched for it.
Finally she found it under her bed.
Lifting it to her face, she examined it.
She saw that the clasp had broken.
Eric wanted to make tacos for his family for dinner.
He went to the grocery store to purchase the ingredients.
When Eric got home, he realized he forgot to buy taco shells.
Eric didn't have enough time to get back to the store before closing.
He decided to make a taco salad instead.
A small town had been plagued with thefts.
Everyone was on alert, hoping to catch the culprit.
One woman noticed someone suspicious on her street.
She called the police.
They investigated the man and he was indeed the thief.
Jerry's mother told him to always put his shoes away.
Jerry did not always listen.
When it was time to get dressed he could not find his shoes.
He looked all over the house while they got later and later.
Jerry's mother found his shoes in the shower.
I went to the bookstore.
I found a book that I thought was interesting.
When I brought it to the cashier, he said the book cost 6 dollars.
I only had 5 dollars.
I did not buy the book.
Jay went to the hardware store to get sandpaper.
He was annoyed by how expensive it was.
Instead he purchased glue, sand and paper.
He made his own sandpaper that out performed the store's.
Jay sold his extra sandpaper to the store at a great profit.
Dominick went to school.
He went to play kick ball with his friends.
It was his turn to kick the ball.
When he kicked the ball his shoe split in half.
Dominick had to get a pair of new shoes.
George was running late for his Valentine's day dinner with his wife.
He picked up a really beautiful bouquet of flowers and hailed a taxi.
After getting settled inside, he realized he knew the driver!
It was Rob, the quarterback from high school who had picked on George!
George just smiled and enjoyed the envious expression on Rob's face.
Anna was doing badly in school.
She worked hard, but struggled to understand the concepts.
So she went for tutoring after classes.
The tutors helped her grasp the ideas and learn more.
Soon her grades had improved drastically!
In the courthouse a brilliant lawyer was defending a man on trial.
The opposition claimed the defendant committed arson at his home.
The brilliant lawyer denied these claims and said it was an accident.
The lawyer had a fireman as a witness to say it was an act of god.
The jury was not convinced by this argument and found him guilty.
Today was street cleaning day in Cambridge.
We woke up to watch cars being towed.
There were only two cars today.
One was towed, but the other was not.
We were mystified.
Jamie notices that he has gained weight over the last few months.
He decides he needs to start exercising more.
He puts on a pair of sneakers and goes for a run in his neighborhood.
When he is done he feels exhausted.
However, he feels very happy to be getting in better shape.
We decided to get on go carts.
We started racing each other.
We went around the track several times.
My son kept winning every lap.
We laughed and enjoyed ourselves.
Eli was walking around on the farm.
He was visiting his friend, Farmer John.
He saw a beautiful peacock wander by.
Farmer John told him it was one of his new farm animals.
Eli complimented him on the beautiful bird.
Tim was extremely nervous.
His companies promotion cycle was coming to an end.
Tim had worked hard, but had fallen behind on his mortgage payment.
He really need a big raise to meet ends meet.
Fortunately, Tim got a massive raise and a bonus for his hard work.
Lucy was stunned.
Her crush had just kissed another girl.
She stared out the window as her grandma drove home.
Her grandma asked what was wrong.
Lucy sat silent, she was too hurt to answer.
Niles escaped from prison.
He used devious methods to slip away.
But he didn't count on tracker dogs!
The guards set dogs on his scent.
Within hours, Niles was caught and jailed - again.
Alan found out he had termites in his apartment.
He called his apartment's pest control to deal with it.
Unfortunately, it was so bad that he had to leave for them to finish.
Alan decided to spend a week with his cousins while it was dealt with.
When Alan came back the termites were gone!
Arnold learned how to write the alphabet slowly.
His teacher kept putting the pencil in his right hand.
It didn't feel right so he quickly became frustrated.
He learned he was left handed later.
He continued to be insecure about his handwriting.
Cathy recently had the feeling of wanting to serve others.
Cathy asked her mother for organizations that serve others.
Cathy found a local soup kitchen that feeds the homeless.
After meeting with the president, Cathy was asked to volunteer.
Cathy thoroughly enjoyed volunteering at the soup kitchen.
Raven drew some doodles.
People in her class all watched her.
They really liked it.
They started asking her to draw for them.
She got money for it.
Universal Studios in Florida is my favorite theme park.
My Dad and his boyfriend took me there over Thanksgiving.
While standing in a long line we played Heads Up to pass the time.
My Dad almost fell over backwards when the stone dragon breathed fire.
This lead to a discussion about new Heads Up categories.
Jeffrey loved oranges more than any fruit.
Unfortunately, his family also loved oranges.
They would always eat all of the oranges before he could have any.
So, Jeffrey hid the oranges in a box that said it was celery.
His family never looked in it, and his oranges were safe!
Arlene couldn't find her pearl necklace.
She decided that the babysitter had stolen them.
She called the babysitter's mom and demanded they pay for the pearls.
The babysitter's mother burst into tears.
Later that night, Arlene found the necklace in her bathroom.
My daughter wants to take her toddler to the Enchanted Village.
This is a puppet show featuring early 20th century figurines.
The show used to be displayed in a store in Boston.
It has since moved to the suburbs.
I will go but I think the Enchanted Village is spooky.
Sandra was trying to do her makeup.
She had it all perfect and was just doing mascara.
Suddenly she sneezed and her mascara wand hit her cheek.
She tried to wipe the black mark off but it ruined her whole face.
She had to start over but it looked better the second time.
Jane had a really bad temper.
One day she got into an argument with her mother.
Jane was upset that her mother didn't let her watch TV past 9 PM.
Jane got so mad that she punched the wall.
Jane felt terrible about what she did afterwards.
I really wanted an online transcription job.
I practiced and practiced my touch typing for weeks.
I finally decided to log on to take the application typing test.
As I began I realized it had the same paragraphs I'd been practicing.
I breezed through it easily, securing the job.
Gina's friend Mary was jealous of Gina's new book.
So Gina made it a point to be seen with the book as much as possible.
Mary and her other friends began to work on their math assignment.
Gina continued to peruse her new book.
She could tell she was getting under Mary's skin.
Tina wanted a piercing.
She wanted it to be her tongue.
So she got it done.
It hurt very badly.
Tina regretted it.
Our coworker Linda was married.
She was told she could never have children.
She overate to compensate for her sadness.
One day, she got pregnant, and had a normal baby.
She had another one a few years later, and is very happy.
I submitted my short story into a school literary magazine.
I waited months for the magazine to be printed.
The magazine released yesterday.
I quickly scanned through the pages when I got it.
My work was actually featured in the literary magazine!
Beth was on lunch and decided to eat in her car.
In the canal in front of her car Beth spotted an alligator.
Beth decided to move her car before she went back inside.
The alligator moved to the new spot Beth was parked and watched.
Beth quickly made her way back inside watching over her shoulder.
Mark lived below an office who just installed a new doorbell.
Mark could hear the doorbell clearly in his apartment.
Friday evening the doorbell started to ring, over and over and over.
Mark was home sick and being driven crazy by the repetition.
Monday morning Mark went up to the office and shot everyone.
There was a loud noise outside.
The woman felt scared.
She called a friend.
The friend came over.
They could not find the source of the noise.
Abbie wore a karate gi at the audition for the gymnastics team.
She was modest and worried about dressing as the others did.
Her sleeve snagged on something and wrecked her performance.
Natalia's leotard didn't get in the way and allowed for easy movement.
She left Abbie in the dust, teaching her to let go such irrationality.
Betsy was excited for her upcoming birthday.
She was looking forward to a gift from her brother in Virginia.
Finally the big day had arrived.
She went down to the mailbox to look for a package.
He had sent her a beautiful new sweatshirt.
I had a girlfriend who was very petite and skinny.
I did not think she was athletic at all.
One day we went to the swimming pool together.
She could swim twice as fast as me.
This was a good lesson in not judging people by their appearance.
Charles was driving home.
He saw several pieces of furniture placed outside on the street.
He parked his truck to take a look at them.
Besides a few scratches, the furniture looked good.
He loaded the furniture on the back of his truck and left.
Tabitha ran away from home one night.
Her mom searched everywhere for her.
Tabitha managed to stay hidden for a week.
At the end of the week, police tracked her down.
They brought her home.
Susie couldn't decide between the pink bunny and white horse.
They were both so pretty.
She picked the bunny for her merry go round ride.
Then her mom surprised her with another ticket.
So she got to ride the white horse, too!
I went to the shoe store to get some new boots.
The clerk asked me my size and I told him I'm a size ten.
The first pair of boots he brought out felt a little big.
The clerk told me I am actually a size nine.
He brought out a smaller pair and I was amazed how well it fit.
Kevin and his wife had a child.
They were having a hard time coming up with a name.
Kevin and his wife liked different ones.
They asked a mutual respected acquaintance for help.
The acquaintance helped choose between one of the two names.
Bonnie wanted to look amazing for prom.
She did her makeup very carefully, including fake eyelashes.
Halfway through the prom she went into the ladies room.
She noticed right away that one of her lashes had fallen off.
She looked very odd with mis-matched eyelashes.
I just spent an hour putting emails into my trash bin.
I had a lot of emails taking up space.
I was removing the emails one at a time.
I figured out how to use a filter to mass dump the emails.
I am glad I have space now.
Johnson submitted his work to the teacher.
She looked over it.
Although he got every question correct, she gave him an F.
He was immediately confused and contacted the principal.
When he realized this, he fired the teacher.
Zeke went to the department store to buy some shoes.
He went to the sales clerk and asked for a size 9.
The clerk told him he needed to be more specific.
Zeke pick up a boot and asked for it in a size 9.
The clerk checked in the back and brought Zeke the shoe.
The boy walked the dog.
The dog saw a cat.
The dog chased after the cat.
The boy had to let go of the dog.
The dog ran away after the cat.
Cole went to the store with five dollars to spend.
He bought some jerky and a soda.
His little brother spilled his soda and the dog ate his jerky.
Cole's parents saw what happened and gave him five more dollars.
Cole went back to the store for more jerky and a soda.
Cam ordered a pizza and took it home.
He opened the box to take out a slice.
Cam discovered that the store did not cut the pizza for him.
He looked for his pizza cutter but did not find it.
He had to use his chef knife to cut a slice.
Kevin is the proud owner of a Beagle named Mika.
On a rainy day Kevin took Mika on a walk around the block.
Mika didn't like being in the rain and refused to poop.
Kevin brought Mika back to the apartment and went to bed.
Mika pooped on Kevin's new couch and spent the next day in her cage.

341f8495-63e4-4de6-a220-b9447f9ef2bd.storytitle: I went to dinner with some friends.
story: On Thursday, I went to dinner with some friends.
Before leaving the house I had to make sure they had left.
I quickly called Jeff and he confirmed they were already there!
Hopping into the car, I quickly drove to the restaurant.
It was good to finally see my friends after a week!
Selena went to the fair to spend a day of fun in the sun.
She tried a few rides but really wanted to try the new roller coaster.
There was a long line and she waited an hour.
When her time came, she sat down with anticipation.
The ride lasted thirty seconds, but at the end, she was exhilarated.
Donald was diagnosed with lung cancer.
He was devastated by his diagnosis.
Donald was able to get into a clinical trial.
His cancer began to clear up with the treatments.
Today, Donald's cancer is in remission.
Levi aspired to become a astronaut.
He studied very hard in school.
On graduation day he was excited about going to college.
He went to college and graduated with honors.
Levi was accepted into NASA's space training program.
I had a blind date.
We went to dinner.
It was awful.
He refused to pay.
I will never go on another blind date.
Steven sat on his couch playing games on his iPad.
His wife Xiao was curled up next to him with her head in his lap.
Jeannie smiled from across the room.
She thought her son's new wife was beautiful.
Her son looked so relaxed and completely happy.
Jenny was pregnant with her first child.
However, she was gaining a large amount of weight.
Jenny felt confused, since she had been watching what she ate.
She went to the doctor's office to find out what was happening.
The doctor told her she was pregnant with twins.
Fred was using the dishwasher.
He was always washing dishes.
Unfortunately the dishwasher stopped working.
He had to call the repairman.
When the repairman came he fixed it immediately.
Today was such as long day.
My boss had so many high demands.
When he asked me to work overtime I couldn't refuse.
I poured myself an extra cup of coffee.
It will be a long night, here in the office.
Gus put some bacon on a cold pan and turned on the heat.
There was a knock at the door so he went to open it.
At the door was a salesman who sold life insurance.
Gus got so involved with him that he forgot about the bacon.
When the bacon began to sizzle, Gus heard it and remembered the bacon.
Marco has been trying to lose weight ever since last fall.
In order to lose weight he has cut all fried foods from his diet.
However, on his birthday he decides to treat himself.
Marco eats a large order of french fries from a local restaurant.
He is amazed with how good they taste.
Tom volunteered as a big brother.
There was one kid who was particularly bad.
Tom tried a lot of things to break through to him.
Nothing really panned out.
Tom had to give up eventually.
It was a hot day.
Everyone went swimming to get relief from the heat.
Harry did not know how to swim but was fearless.
Harry jumped into the pool and began drowning.
He then realized he was in the shallow end and stood up.
The kids were learning about the Ancient Greeks.
They all dressed up in togas.
The togas were white and billowing.
They read about famous Greeks as well.
It was fun pretending to be part of that era.
Ted needed a job.
His brother knew they were hiring at the shop he worked at.
Ted filled out an application.
He listed his brother as a reference.
Ted got a call for an interview.
Cindy planted a big garden.
Her biggest crop was her pumpkins.
She had one grow and grow until it was huge.
It weighed 500 lbs!
Cindy showed off her pumpkins to all her farmer friends.
I made myself a Ham Sandwich.
I've sat it down and went to the bathroom.
I came out and it was gone.
I looked around and couldn't find it.
Then, I noticed my mom through it away by accident.
I did not enjoy Spanish class this year.
My grades weren't good, so I needed to do well on the final exam.
Studying for hours on end, I stayed up all night before the test.
I passed the final exam with a 92 percent.
I never have to speak Spanish again!
My family got together at the park for the party.
They decided to set up several tables and food outside.
While my family was having fun, it started to get windy.
In addition, the gust of winds knocked all of the equipment down.
We spent the last hour on the beach, cleaning up.
Jenny was a photographer.
Today was her first professional job.
She did a photo shoot for a pregnant couple.
They had a lot of fun during the shoot.
After they were done, the couple promised to leave a positive review.
Tom needed money for bills.
He decided to pawn some items.
He figured he would get them back after he got more money.
He was just barely able to pay his bills.
Tom never got his things back.
I talked to my niece on Saturday.
She has been living with a man for 7 years.
I asked her if she was going to marry him.
She said she wanted to.`.
Her mother came by and glared at her.
Smokey lived alone in a small apartment and could barely pay her rent.
She decided to get a better job but she needed transportation.
A local church decided to buy her a used car as a gift.
Smokey took the car, packed her apartment, loaded it up and left.
No one has heard from her since.
We went to the IHOP with our granddaughter and her parents on Monday.
Our 2-year old granddaughter dictated what each person could eat.
She said her nanny would have orange juice and her uncle pancakes.
I was to have eggs while she was getting chocolate juice.
We were amused by her choices.
My internet started acting strange this morning.
I tried to log in and the screen froze.
Then I got to my work page and it happened again.
I tried to reboot the computer.
It acted better after that.
Henry exchanged $45 with Hannah for a new pair of shoes.
He waited until he got home to put them on.
The bottom sole broke when he tried to walk a couple of steps.
They were Styrofoam when Henry looked under the shoe.
He became frustrated and searched for Hannah outside.
Tess challenged Pirya to a race.
Tess and Priya are both on the track team.
They decide on running the 400m dash.
They take off down the track.
Priya beat Tess by a foot.
Jemma was looking forward to going to the lake today.
However, she saw that it was going to rainy today.
Upset, she thought about other things she could do today instead.
She called a few of her friends and asked them to come over.
Jemma and her friends spent the rest of the day watching movies.
Ben was a businessman at a major corporation.
He was always on time and worked feverishly.
One day, he felt like having some fun in the office.
So he screamed, "Hoorah" and threw his papers in the air, and jumped.
He was immediately fired.
Justin decided to make dinner for his boyfriend.
He went to the store and bought all of the ingredients.
He started cooking but got distracted.
The entire meal was burnt.
Justin ordered pizza instead.
Selena was getting ready for an event.
She put her hair up in a stylish do.
Then she slipped into her beautiful dress.
After slipping on her shoes, she was out.
She arrived to the event with all eyes on her.
I went with a friend to a concert.
It was three dollars to get in.
My friend wanted ice cream.
I asked if you could come back.
They joked that you had to pay another three dollars.
Out of all the desserts, Bob like slushy drinks.
Fruit flavored were his favorite.
His mouth was always red from eating them.
Some people told him he shouldn't eat them.
But he still does everyday.
Sammie was going to visit his best friend.
Only problem he didn't know where his friend lived.
He called up his friend to get directions.
Sammie wrote down the directions.
He still ended up lost because his friend had given him the wrong house address.
I needed to move my car out of the garage so I could fix my motorcycle.
The car had been sitting for about six months.
When I tried to start it the battery was dead and it would not start.
I put the battery charger on it and waited for a while.
When I tried it again it started so I could move it.
Tom worked hard on his costume.
It was an obscure reference.
He hoped people would get it.
Unfortunately nobody ever did.
Tom was disappointed and sad.
Stephanie had a craving for Mexican food.
She looked online for some restaurants.
She couldn't really find any with good reviews.
Stephanie decided to call her friend and ask for a recommendation.
She ended up following her friend's advice and was satisfied.
An atheist woman and a christian woman met every week for tea.
They liked to discuss the world and their vision of it.
They often disagreed on many subjects.
But when it came to helping others, they thought the same way.
They always ended up giving one dollar to a homeless person after tea.
I got a professional massage today for the first time ever.
I've been real stressed out lately and a friend said I should go.
I went and bought a one hour massage.
It felt so good and my muscles feel so loose now.
I'm addicted to them now, I've already bought two more!
My best friend went to work as she normally does.
She was looking forward to a holiday launch celebration.
While enjoying the luncheon, a man came in with a gun.
He started shooting at everyone in the room.
My friend was shot and is in the hospital with a hopeful prognosis.
Eddie bought a donkey.
The donkey wouldn't pull any carts though.
When he tried to hitch up the cart, the donkey kicked him.
Eddie went back to the market attempting to resell the donkey.
Everyone knew about his donkey, and didn't buy it.
I had to stay in the hospital for several hours.
Unfortunately, my phone had 5% left.
Since I had no charger, I had to keep my phone off.
In order to call people, I had to use the hospital's telephone.
I also had to postpone my assignments since the internet was inactive.
Tim had to work on his birthday.
He trudged home in the late afternoon, tired and bummed.
He wished he could've celebrated his birthday.
But when he got home, dozens of people jumped out at him.
Tim grinned as he saw his surprise party!
Rae and her mom decided to walk door to door to sell cookies.
They walked up and down the neighborhood.
They knocked on every door and almost everyone bought something!
Rae was very proud of her sales!
She sold the most in her troop and won a prize.

1a23a1b8-18e7-4a78-a640-9d01a8db8567.storytitle: Child Support, and Trumped Up Harassment Settlements
story: Fred began dating a woman that seemed fun and outgoing.
After a year, she got pregnant and they planned were excited.
Soon, Fred found out she made most of her income from child support.
Turns out, fun and outgoing was really an addiction to partying.
Fred wishes he had known this before it was too late, but didn't.
Beth worked through her lunch and was hungry.
She was upset to see the cafeteria was closed.
She ran downstairs to the hot dog vendor outside.
When she got to her desk she realized she forgot mustard.
There was no time to go back so Beth ate the hot dog dry.
Mandy warned her boyfriend, Dave, that she hated surprise parties.
Dave thought she was sending him a message in code.
He was confident she was hinting that she desired such a birthday.
He went to great effort to throw her an elaborate surprise party.
Initially angry, Mandy calmed down when she saw how hard he'd worked.
Sean was poor.
He decided to rob his friend.
He held his friend at gunpoint and stole his money.
Sean later felt guilty about the robbery.
He confessed at the police station and eventually went to prison.
Jim was delivering pizzas.
He knocked on the door of his customer.
She answered, took the pizza, and counted her money.
She did not have enough money to tip him!
She awkwardly offered Jim a candy bar instead of a tip.
The race gun went off.
The crowd started fast.
Gary tried to keep a leader's pace.
He ran out of energy.
He dropped out of the race early.
Matt was playing outfield for his school baseball team.
He hated baseball but his parents made him play.
As the game went on Matt started day dreaming.
He was not interested and figured no one would hit to him.
All of sudden the batter hit the ball right into Matt's mitt.
My daughter's college roommate was rich.
Her father had retired at forty five.
He complained about the high cost of college.
He applied for financial aid and was denied.
I thought he was being very facetious, and thought less of him.
Vicki was scared of heights.
Vicki was an architect.
Vicki was hired to build a new skyscraper.
Vicki visited a very tall building to study the upper levels.
Vicki designed an exceptionally safe skyscraper.
Ryan wanted to give Darcy a massage.
Darcy decided to let him.
She sat on the floor in front of his chair.
Ryan rubbed her neck, shoulders, and back.
Darcy was nice to Ryan after that.
Harry was a larger than average man.
He ate plenty but felt scrawny and weak.
He realized that he wasn't eating enough and designed a new diet.
At first it was thought to implement but soon he had it down.
Luckily he quickly began feeling healthier.
Matt is moving away.
He said bye to all his friends.
He wanted a last party.
His friends threw him a moving away party.
He cried but is happy.
Kim was on a flight.
It hit some strong winds.
The airplane felt a lot of turbulence.
Kim was really scared the entire time.
She was nervous for days after getting off.
Lindsay was very interested in guitar lessons.
She looked online for studios or individuals offering classes.
She weighed the options and decided to go with Falcetti Music.
Lindsay went through a few weeks of classes.
Her skills are becoming better and better.
There was a big fire.
The fireman came by to stop it.
There were still 2 kids in there.
The fireman went in to save them.
He saved them and put out the fire.
Glen was in a bad car accident.
He called a lawyer he saw in a commercial.
The lawyer promised to get Glen the money he deserved.
Glen worked with the lawyer who contacted the insurance company.
Glen got a cash settlement from the insurance company.
Tim got a new job.
It was his first job after college.
Tim was very overwhelmed.
He was eventually fired because he made so many mistakes.
Tim learned that life isn't as easy as he thought it would be.
Jane never felt comfortable in her own skin.
She grew up thinking she wasn't being the person she wanted to be.
She never told anyone about this, and learned to put up with it.
At age 30, she finally realised that she felt that she should be male.
When she identified as transgender, she suddenly felt happy at last.
My car suddenly got a high temperature.
I was driving on the highway at the time.
I pulled over to check under the smoking hood.
My car had blown a head gasket.
Fortunately I was able to fix it myself during my vacation.
Amy was in trouble.
She had taken her sister with her to May's
While there her sister got into a fight.
Amy was too tired to care that her mother grounded her.
Amy went to her room, closed the door, and went to sleep.
Elaine decided that she would start a walking routine.
Elaine needed to find a time that would be suitable for walking.
After giving some thought, Elaine decided that early morning was best.
Elaine went for her first morning walk on Saturday.
Elaine loved her walk, and was looking forward to tomorrow's walk.
I set off to climb the mountain at 4:00am with everything I needed.
The doctors said I wasn't strong enough at this stage of my illness.
I ascended, one step at a time, resting when I felt ill.
I almost turned around, but determination drove me onward.
By sunset I'd conquered the mountain and proved everyone wrong.
Jessie wanted to go to a new club everyone was talking about.
She and her friends dressed in their nicest club attire.
They walked into the club.
Everyone was giving them attention.
They felt anxious and then left.
Sue and her dad went fishing in his boat.
After they caught a few fish, they decided to head back home.
Her father tried to start the motor, but it wouldn't start.
Fortunately he had some oars, and Sue helped him paddle back to shore.
Her arms were very tired, but she was still glad she went fishing.
William was a sailor on a boat in 1700.
He hoped he could get passage to America by working on the boat.
While at sea a horrible storm hit, and wrecked the boat.
William struggled to survive in the water, clinging to broken wood.
He woke on a beach, and found himself in Canada.
Kelly and Fred had been together for four Year's.
Fred and Kelly went to a nice restaurant last night.
During the meal he got down on one knee and proposed.
Kelly was shocked.
He put the ring on her finger and it glistened.
Soren ran through the airport, pulling her bags behind her.
The female voice above her announced final boarding to Soren's fligh.
She yelled for them to wait as she neared her gate, waving her arms.
The attendant at the desk gave Soren a sad, sympathetic look.
Nearly out of breath, Soren presented her pass and boarded the plane.
Bryan went to the ice rink with his friends.
Bryan got out his hockey stick and put on his skates.
Bryan played hockey on the rink with his friends.
Bryan's team won 2-0.
Bryan took off his gear and went home.
Johnny picked up a bag of chips in a corner store.
He paid for the bag of chips.
He noticed that the cashier gave him an extra dollar in his change.
He went back inside the store to return the dollar.
The cashier smiled and thanked him for his deed.
John loves playing cards.
John challenges Jimmy to a card game.
Jimmy defeats John.
John practices for several days.
John defeats Jimmy after a week.
Kyle was playing basketball with his friends on the local court.
Suddenly a group of younger boys approached.
They challenged Kyle's team to a match.
Kyle's team laughed at their puny opponents, and accepted.
But the joke was on them-the younger boys beat them badly!
Bill had a dog named Charlie.
Charlie and Bill liked to play frisbee.
They went to the park and Bill threw the frisbee as hard as he could.
Charlie ran and jumped into the sky.
Charlie caught the frisbee and brought it back to Bill.
James started brushing his teeth.
Then he flossed, and finally used mouthwash.
He went into the bedroom.
A girl was waiting for him.
He kissed her, but her breath was really bad.
After class when I was walking to my car I noticed something.
My window was broken!
I was very nervous when I approached the car.
When I got closer I noticed that only one thing was missing.
Someone had stolen my car radio.
Last week I got a new cat.
I loved the cat.
The only problem was that she seemed scared of me.
I then started giving her a lot of treats.
She then ended up linking me.
Carl's favorite drink is a hot cup of coffee.
He would drink about 10 cups a day.
One day he ran out of coffee and was forced to drink tea.
To his surprise he actually liked the tea almost as much as coffee.
Now he says his favorite drinks are coffee and tea.
I was taking a test at school.
My friend was sitting next to me.
Neither of us studied.
We stealthily exchanged answers.
Both of us passed the test.
Jake was a delivery boy for a pizza restaurant.
He was making a delivery on his bike.
He tripped over a rock on the street.
He fell and all the pizzas fell onto the ground.
Jake got fired from his job for not being careful.
Peterson wanted a tablet to play games with his friends.
The only issue was he didn't have the money.
Peterson worked hard and was able to get some money.
After many months he had enough money to buy it.
After Peterson bought the tablet, he played with his friends.
I bought a cookie jar just for cookies in our home.
It was a retro Beetlejuice cookie jar.
We put it on the counter, and we can get a cookie every day from it.
Right now it has lots of raisin cookies in it, so we can eat them.
It's keeping the cookies nice and fresh.
Sam and Sue decided to travel to Sally's house.
The trip to Sally's house would take 2 days driving in a car.
Sam and Sue began driving and finally made it to Sally's house.
When they knocked on the door, an unknown man answered the door.
Sally had moved to another town and never told Sam and Sue!
Lunch time had arrived and Lisa was starving.
She hadn't bought any groceries for the week.
Lisa searched through her cabinets and fridge.
All she found was some bread, peanut butter and bananas.
Lisa enjoyed a peanut butter and banana sandwich.
I wanted to surprise my girlfriend last week
I know her favorite flowers.
Unfortunately they're not in season.
So I went online and found a place that had them.
I special ordered them and loved the look on her face when she got the
Sally bought some thrift store clothes for a low price.
Sally's father complained that she shouldn't be shopping there.
He told her that they had money and didn't need to do so.
Sally did not understand why cheaper good-quality clothes were bad.
When Sally moved out later in life, she never stopped thrift shopping.
Jane was doing laundry.
She wanted to dry her clothes on the clothes line.
But it was getting dark.
As she hung the clothes she felt something on her foot.
She was horrified to see a bat on her shoe.
I rescued a stray dog I found walking around my town.
The dog was small, black and very dirty.
I gave him a bath and fed him at my house.
I then posted an advertisement on Craigslist to find the owner.
I still have not been able to find the owner, unfortunately.
I tried impressing my friend who was from China by using chopsticks.
I used chopsticks before in the past.
So I tried using it again and ended up failing.
I was holding it completely wrong because it's been a long time.
My friend from China laughed at my attempt.
Carrie woke up early today to see the sun rise.
She took a packed breakfast and walked to the tallest hill.
As the sun's first rays rose above the horizon, she smiled.
She sipped her coffee and watched the colors in the sky.
She decided then and there that she would do it again, tomorrow.
The cat start eating the handles off of a plastic bag.
The next day we saw that they had trouble passing it.
We had to take them to a vet to help us.
The bill was very expensive.
We were very upset at the cat.
Amanda's engagement ring was her prized possession.
One day she realized it had become discolored.
She immediately took the jewelry to a professional.
Luckily, they were able to fix the discoloration.
Soon, Amanda's ring was back to perfect condition quickly.
Jill was angry at her mother.
She hated being forced to wake up and go to school.
Eventually, she threw her clothes on and stomped her way into the car.
When Jill arrived at school, she left saying nothing to her mother.
At lunch, Jill stared at the food her mother made and felt sorry.
Jean was looking for a job.
She found an ad in the local paper.
Jean applied to the job listed in the paper.
A woman called Jean to schedule an interview.
Jean got the job.
I discovered a woman will be running for president.
I researched her background to see where she stands on the issues.
I rather liked her progressive agenda.
I decided I want to vote for a woman for US president.
I registered to vote and I will vote for her in November.
Bill heard from a co-worker that the company was going under.
Bill also heard rumors about upcoming layoffs.
Bill prepared for the worst as he was called into the boss's office.
Bill gripped the arms of his chair as his boss began to speak.
Bill was offered a promotion because he could help save the company!
Cameron's tooth was loose.
He was wiggling it all day but it wouldn't come out.
He started complaining to his dad.
His dad decided to yank the tooth out.
Cameron was scared, but luckily it came out with no pain.
I drove into the parking lot of the gym and saw a tiny orange shape.
It was a tiny kitten, barely alive, I grabbed a blanket right away.
We rushed him to the emergency vet, but they couldn't save him.
We named him Carmel and paid for his cremation, both of us bawling.
The vet sent a beautiful card, thanking us for caring about animals.
Jon decided to go on vacation.
He hired someone to take care of his dog while he was gone.
One day, the person he hired forgot to feed the dog.
The dog had to go hungry!
When Jon figured out, he fired the person.
The boy went to a video arcade.
He played his favorite machine.
His games didn't go very well.
He told the owner about his experience.
The owner explained that he had made the game settings harder.
Dan decided to incorporate more fresh vegetables into his diet.
He bought some fetching specimens from a local farmer.
Dan didn't remember to wash them off when he got home.
After eating them his stomach was very upset.
Dan got a stomach virus from eating the vegetables.
Jim was speeding on the highway since he was late to work.
Although he didn't notice a cop car, he drove past it.
The siren of the cop car turned on and the officer followed him.
Jim had to stop on the side of the road.
The police officer handed him a ticket.
Remy was digging through his backpack.
Suddenly, he realized that there was something wet.
He took a closer look and realized he had spilled his soda.
He took everything out of the bag.
Then, he washed the bag in the sink.
Jane went to a concert.
She saw her favorite artist performing on stage.
He stuck his hand out.
Jane immediately grabbed it.
He pulled her on stage and sang in front of her.
John decided to write a rap for his friend.
This rap was going to be fast and smooth.
He spent many hours writing and developed a cool song.
He published it with the record album and received the album.
Then, John gave the album to his friend as a gift.
